homes_hear_details: Idaho's HOMES and HEAR programs are pending launch. The Idaho Office of Energy and Mineral Resources is developing program guidelines and implementation plans using approximately $30 million in IRA funding allocated to the state.
state_energy_office: Idaho Office of Energy and Mineral Resources

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For a family of four in Boise, 80% AMI is approximately $58,250. Low-income households will qualify for the highest rebate levels under HOMES when launched.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For a family of four in Boise, 150% AMI is approximately $109,200. Moderate-income households will qualify for partial rebates under HOMES when launched.

net_metering: Idaho offers net metering for systems up to 100 kW for residential customers. Customers receive a credit at the utility's avoided cost rate for excess generation, which is lower than the retail rate. Credits carry over monthly and are reconciled annually.

state_tax_credits.name: Idaho Residential Alternative Energy Tax Deduction
state_tax_credits.amount: 40% of cost in year one (up to $5,000), then 20% per year for the next three years (up to $5,000 total deduction)
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar PV, solar thermal, geothermal, wind, and fuel cell systems for residential properties
state_tax_credits.details: This is a state income tax deduction, not a credit. The total deduction cannot exceed $20,000 over four years. Must be for the taxpayer's primary residence in Idaho.

state_rebate_programs.name: Idaho Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, furnace repair or replacement, window repair, and other weatherization measures
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program available to low-income households. Income must be at or below 200% of the federal poverty level.

programs.name: Home Improvement Program
programs.amount: Varies by measure: up to $1,000 for heat pumps, $100-$400 for weatherization
programs.eligible_items: Ductless heat pumps, central heat pumps, insulation, windows, smart thermostats

programs.name: Net Metering Program
programs.amount: Monthly credits at published avoided cost rate
programs.eligible_items: Solar PV, wind, and other qualifying renewable energy systems up to 100 kW

programs.name: Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, insulation, windows, smart thermostats, water heaters

programs.name: Wattsmart Residential Program
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, weatherization, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances
